name: The MSU Accafellas
description:
The MSU '''Accafellas''' are a Tenor-Bass [[collegiate a cappella]] group from [[Michigan State University]] in [[East Lansing, Michigan]], one of the six a cappella groups on campus.  Founded in 1996, the group typically has between eight to fourteen singers. The Accafellas have released 8 albums to date.  Their arrangement of [[Jason Mraz]]'s "[[You and I Both]]" appeared on Varsity Vocal's ''Best of College A Capella (BOCA)'' compilation in 2006.  In 2010, The Accafellas performed their arrangements of "[[Walking in Memphis]]" by [[Marc Cohn]] and "[[Would You Go With Me]]" in [[Nashville, Tennessee]] before the [[CMA Music Festival]] with [[Josh Turner]].{{citation needed|date=September 2025}}

The group often sings at events on the campus of Michigan State, dorms, weddings (often of Accafellas' alumni) as well as various locations around the nation.  The group has performed at [[The White House]], as well as [[Michigan]] Governor [[Jennifer Granholm]]'s personal residence.
